etymologies: Old English sadol, sadul, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch zadel and German Sattel, perhaps from an Indo-European root shared by Latin sella ‘seat’ and sit

definitions: a seat fastened on the back of a horse or other animal for riding, typically made of leather and raised at the front and rear.
shortDefinitions: seat fastened on back of horse or other animal for riding

definitions: a seat on a bicycle or motorcycle.
a low part of a ridge between two higher points or peaks

examples.text: follow the road which goes across the saddle between two tors

shortDefinitions: low part of ridge between two higher points or peaks

definitions: a low region of a curve between two high points, especially (in three dimensions) one representing the highest point of a curve in one direction and the lowest point in another direction.
shortDefinitions: low region of curve between two high points

definitions: a shaped support on which a cable, wire, or pipe rests.
shortDefinitions: shaped support on which cable, wire, or pipe rests

definitions: a fireclay bar for supporting ceramic ware in a kiln.
shortDefinitions: fireclay bar for supporting ceramic ware in kiln

definitions: the part of a draft horse's harness which supports the straps to which the shafts are attached.
shortDefinitions: part of draught horse's harness which supports straps

definitions: the lower part of the back in a mammal or fowl, especially when distinct in shape or marking

examples.text: feathers at the rear of a rooster's saddle

shortDefinitions: lower part of back in mammal or fowl

definitions: a large cut of meat consisting of the two loins

examples.text: a recipe for saddle of hare

shortDefinitions: joint of meat consisting of two loins

examples.text: he was in the stable saddling up his horse

definitions: burden (someone) with an onerous responsibility or task

examples.text: he's saddled with debts of $12 million

shortDefinitions: burden someone with onerous responsibility or task

definitions: (of a trainer) enter (a horse) for a race.
